text:
When using special chars in taglibs tag name, the
java compiler won't translate the generated JspServlet, since the name in the tag-lib name, is used directly to generate some variable in the implementation.
creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org
marc.saegesser@apropos.com
text:
I'm not sure exactly what is meant by 'special chars', but the specification 
states that tag names are defined to be of type NMTOKEN which limits the 
characters that can be used.

creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com
text:
Got email from the original submitter and the 'special char' was a minus sign, 
which turns out to be a valid NMTOKEN character according to the XML 
specification.  Jasper should probably mangle the NMTOKEN values into strings 
taht are valid Java identifiers.

Won't make it into 3.2.2 but this should get some additional research for 
possible solutions in 3.3 or 4.0.
creator: marc.saegesser@apropos.com
